headline.main: New Fighting Breaks Out Near Biggest Libyan Oil Port
headline.print_headline: New Fighting Breaks Out Near Biggest Libyan Oil Port

docs.lead_paragraph: Libyan armed factions accused each other on Monday of launching new attacks near the country's largest oil port, Es Sider.

headline.main: Sampdoria Send Okaka Home After Row With Coach
headline.print_headline: Sampdoria Send Okaka Home After Row With Coach

docs.lead_paragraph: Sampdoria striker Stefano Okaka was sent home after a row with coach Sinisa Mihajlovic during training, the club said on Monday.

headline.main: Yemeni Houthi Fighters Surround PM's Home: Government Spokesman
headline.print_headline: Yemeni Houthi Fighters Surround PM's Home: Government Spokesman

docs.lead_paragraph: Yemeni Houthi fighters on Monday surrounded the Republican Palace in central Sanaa, where the prime minister lives, a government spokesman told Reuters.

headline.main: French Woman Kidnapped in Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: French Woman Kidnapped in Central African Republic

docs.lead_paragraph: A French charity worker and a churchman were abducted on Monday in Bangui, the capital of Central African Republic, the French Foreign Ministry and the Caritas charity said.

headline.main: Merkel-ECB Action No Substitute for Economic Reform
headline.print_headline: Merkel-ECB Action No Substitute for Economic Reform

docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's chancellor made a rare public intervention in the debate about money printing by the European Central Bank on Monday, warning it was no substitute for economic reforms in the euro zone.

headline.main: Ex-Salvador Ambassador, Critic of US Foreign Policy, Dies
headline.print_headline: Ex-Salvador Ambassador, Critic of US Foreign Policy, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: Robert E. White, a former U.S. ambassador to El Salvador and strong critic of U.S. policy in the region during the Central American wars, has died at age 88, according to the Washington-based Center for International Policy where he was a senior fellow .

headline.main: U.N. Holds Talks to Calm North Mali Town as Armed Groups Clash
headline.print_headline: U.N. Holds Talks to Calm North Mali Town as Armed Groups Clash

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. mission in Mali said on Monday it was holding emergency talks between armed groups who have fought gunbattles in a town in northern Mali.
